Text.Name: Header/Sub_Header
Text.Text: Use the built-in UI to monitor and control all active SEP stations.

Text.Name: Title
Text.Text: SEP station title* and show/hide experiment toggle

Text.Name: Completion
Text.Text: Data collection is represented by the light green bar; experiment calibration is represented by the dark green background bar

Text.Name: TitleNote/Text
Text.Text: Vessel name can be changed from the SEP Central Station context menu.

Text.Name: TransmitNote/Text
Text.Text: Autotransmit only available when tech tree upgrade is purchased.

Text.Name: Header/Sub_Header
Text.Text: Choose your experiments and activate them with a scientist on EVA.

Text.Name: Experiments/Text
Text.Text: • Each experiment has three increasing levels of science data: basic, detailed, and exhaustive. • Each level rewards science points from a single pool; e.g. completing the basic experiment will count for 66% of the detailed and 50% of the exhaustive experiments’ science data. • The max available experiment level is influenced by the instrument's calibration.

Text.Name: EVA
Text.Text: A scientist on EVA (other professions can be used with a penalty to calibration) can setup and control an experiment connected to the SEP Central Station.

Text.Name: Action
Text.Text: Experiment status, calibration level, completion level, and time to the next data set are all shown in the part context menu.

Text.Name: Editor
Text.Text: All SEP experiments have a Complexity level. This value influences the level of scientist required to fully calibrate each experiment. The Standard Time To Completion value represents the time required for a fully calibrated experiment to collect all data. Also, note the electricity requirement; this is only present for some of the experiments.

Text.Name: Header/Sub_Header
Text.Text: Use KIS and KAS* to attach all instruments to the surface and connect to each other.

Text.Name: Attach
Text.Text: Attach power plugs to experiment socket points.

Text.Name: Station
Text.Text: The SEP Central Station is required for all experiments and serves as a control hub and transmitter.

Text.Name: Power
Text.Text: Attach the included SEP girder and solar panels, or an RTG to power experiments.

Text.Name: Inventory
Text.Text: Load up the KIS inventory with SEP parts.

Text.Name: Header/Sub_Header
Text.Text: Once started, data will be collected over time for each experiment.

Text.Name: Upgrade
Text.Text: An upgrade from the tech tree allows the SEP Central Station to automatically transmit results as soon as they are ready, even for unloaded vessels.

Text.Name: Science
Text.Text: Two levels of science results are shown here, Basic and Detailed. After returning the Basic results the Detailed results only have one third of the remaining science data to collect.

Text.Name: Station
Text.Text: The SEP Central Station can be used to monitor the status of all connected experiments. Any results that are ready can also be collected here. The station is also a probe command core and a short range transmitter.

Text.Name: Data/Text
Text.Text: • All data collection is processed in the background at regular intervals. • Data collection rate is affected by calibration level and CommNet connection status. • Data can be collected by a Kerbal on EVA, transmitted directly from the station, or, if the station is upgraded, transmitted automatically upon completion.

Text.Name: Byline/Text
Text.Text: AlbertKermin: Original concept, parts, and science results CobaltWolf: Part models and textures DMagic: Plugin coding, and experiment design
